content: @WG-prioritization hey, with @apiraino, we were working on a better and more complete version of our procedure
We come up with https://hackmd.io/WJ0G17DHTHGgv0OW9I2PxA
please check it out and feel free to fix mistakes, see if you really understand it and make all the suggestions you want
I may have not done a great job explaining some things, so do not hesitate to point out where explanations are not great

@WG-prioritization, @apiraino have just force pushed this to the existing PR, I think it's ready to be merged but if someone wants to give that it read and try to see if everything makes sense would be great
The PR is forge#395

@Santiago Pastorino once also the pr describing priority levels will be merged, do you see other missing bits to the issue about describing the prioritization procedure?

I had a look "around", also went back to old revisions of this document https://hackmd.io/P3yvagSSS7yAI2QxhLfPtQ?view when it contained "todo" items. My understanding is that all items in that list should be more or less now documented
@apiraino right, everything is documented now
and btw, I've killed most of our hackmd documents
now our landing page is https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team-prioritization/
the README of that repo represents what it was our master document
from there you can find a link to a procedure that now lives on forge
and also a link to our checkins document which has all the status updates from the working group
btw, we should probably add all this stuff to the checkin document :)
I meant, the progress made about documentation
what are the "check-ins" documents for? Kind of a changelog/history?
btw I find the documentation to be more tidy and easily discoverable :thumbs_up:
during compiler meetings working groups give some kind of status update, the check-ins document contains all the relevant news for that meeting
you will find there old check-ins that we've shared in compiler meetings and where it says current, you will find what is going to be our next check-in

I'd gently nudge for updates about this pr detailing the priority levels, following the last update I could find about it.
@o0Ignition0o - Jeremy Lempereur Maybe could use some help from me? Some comments are actionable and straightforward also for me, other needs perhaps more context
oh i m super sorry, i ve had quite a bit on my plate lately :sweat_smile: so yeah some comments do need a bit more context, but let me address the straightforward ones right now!
Looks like i would actually need to rebase against master to push it forward, let s do this
no worries ;-) (I'm just clicking things around :laughing: )

Ok so I adressed most of the issues i think i could. I however am not really sure of what I should do with the rest of them, @apiraino @LeSeulArtichaut would you mind giving me a hint please ? :blush:
nicely done. I'd say if some comments on that issue are unresolved perhaps we could briefly mention them during the next meeting when everyone is there and swiftly sort them out
I've made a couple of comments
